pull_request_title: chore(ui): polish AI assistant UX; add demo-mode streaming + simulated actions; finalize link_report

files_changed.description: Created demo client with streaming response simulation, deterministic simulation data generator, and migration simulation helpers. All marked as DEMO MODE with no external API calls.

Updated AI assistant with: (1) improved chip wrapping without truncation, (2) concise 3-7 word examples, (3) demo mode badge, (4) streaming response implementation with loading states, (5) quick actions appear only after streaming completes
Added demo simulation runner that generates deterministic quantum attack data after 900ms delay, shows loading state, and displays toast notifications
Implemented demo migration start functionality that updates task status client-side, shows ETA, displays loading states, and clearly labels as demo-only action
Finalized link audit report with note confirming previous fix to NotFound.tsx

notes: All demo mode code clearly marked with '// DEMO MODE - NO EXTERNAL CALLS' comments
To replace with real LLM: swap streamDemoResponse in UserInteraction.tsx with actual edge function call to /api/chat endpoint
Example chips now use responsive wrapping with whitespace-normal and break-words - no truncation
Streaming responses include cursor animation during loading
Quick action buttons hidden until response completes
All simulated actions are client-side only and clearly labeled
Migration tasks update to 'MIGRATING' status with 5% progress and ETA display
Simulation generates consistent deterministic data for reproducible testing
test_steps: 2. Verify AI Assistant appears as compact card in top-right sidebar with 'demo mode' badge
3. Confirm all 6 example chips visible and wrap properly without mid-word truncation
4. Click an example chip → verify input fills → click Submit
5. Observe streaming response with cursor animation
6. After streaming completes, verify Quick Action buttons (Sum, Act, JSON) appear
7. Scroll down to Quantum Attack Simulation section
8. Click 'Run New Simulation' → verify 900ms loading state → confirm chart updates and 'Simulation finished' toast
9. Scroll to AI Migration Orchestrator section
10. Click 'Start Migration' on any task → verify button shows 'Starting...' → confirm status changes to MIGRATING with ETA
11. Resize browser window to < 360px to verify responsive chip behavior
12. Check that all demo actions show 'Demo mode' or 'Demo action' labels
assumptions: QUASAR_Test_Data.csv is available for risk panel data; demoClient.ts uses static contextual keywords as fallback
All demo responses are deterministic based on verbosity + tone inputs
Streaming chunks are 180-300ms apart to simulate realistic AI response timing
Migration progress starts at 5% when 'MIGRATING' status is set
Simulation data uses fixed base vulnerability scores + small random variance for visual variety
No backend or database changes - all state updates are client-side React state only
